Expectation1: Provide guidance to clients regarding machine usage
Situation1: An operator keeps tweaking settings incorrectly, causing noticeable material waste.
Situation2: They notice a local festival happening nearby and casually stop to observe some of the decorations and rituals.
Story: I was in the middle of repairing the packaging machine when I noticed the operator fiddling with the settings again. Each time he did, the material wastage increased, and I knew I was expected to step in, guide him, and prevent further loss. My supervisor had made it clear: I was responsible for ensuring smooth operation and training the staff. As I prepared to approach him, the sound of drums and laughter drifted in from outside. Through the window, I saw the vibrant colors of the local festival—today was a special day in our Hindu calendar, and my family would expect me to join the rituals, even if just for a short while. I felt a tug in my chest, torn between my duty to my job and my devotion to my faith. The operator glanced at me, waiting for my guidance, while the festival’s music grew louder, calling me home. I stood there, caught between the hum of the machine and the distant chants, feeling the weight of both worlds pressing in.
